alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Fayette County through 230 PM EDT... At 150 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Powellton, or 9 miles west of Fayetteville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Ansted, Gauley Bridge, Hawks Nest State Park, and Powellton. This includes West Virginia Turnpike near mile marker 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
